author: COMSOL
description: The example models cyclic voltammetry at an electrode of mm dimensions. In this common analytical electrochemistry technique, the potential at a working electrode is swept up and down and the current is recorded. The current-voltage waveform (the voltammogram) gives information about the reactivity and mass transport properties of the analyte.
label: cyclic_voltammetry_1d.mph
name: root

settings.description: Linearize concentration dependence for low concentrations
settings.name: LinearizeConcentrationDependence

settings.description: Smoothing of cyclic voltammetry wave functions
settings.name: EnableTimeSmoothing

settings.description: Add events at vertex potentials in cyclic voltammetry

settings.description: Avoid inverted elements by curving interior domain elements
settings.name: curvedinterior

description: Initial values of variables solved for

description: Values of variables not solved for
settings.name: usesol

settings.description: Split complex variables in real and imaginary parts

settings.description: Allow complex-valued output from functions with real input

settings.description: Stop when undefined mathematical operation is detected

settings.description: Check for undefined numerical values after each operation
settings.name: checkmatherr

settings.description: Drop tolerance for local matrix contributions
settings.name: assemtol

settings.description: Use adaptive tolerance in the linear solver
settings.name: adapttol

description: Use parameter indicator for solution and phase

description: Use parameter indicator for solution and phase

settings.name: autoregenerateevalgroups

title: Cyclic Voltammetry at a Macroelectrode in 1D
